text:
The Department of Cooperatives will conduct special camps at crowded places to receive applications for Amma micro credit scheme.

The camps will be conducted till February 2 except on holidays.

K.C. Ravichandran, Joint Registrar of Cooperatives, told The Hindu that it was an attempt to reach out to the roadside small traders like those selling fruits, vegetables or owning petty shops.

The applications would be processed on the spot by the officials of the respective banks.

The selected beneficiaries could get interest-free loans of up to Rs. 5000 to be disbursed through cooperative banks. The interest of 11 per cent on these loans would be paid to the bank by the State government.

The beneficiaries were supposed to repay the loan in 25 weeks at Rs. 200 a week.

The prompt re-payers would be eligible for a further loan of Rs. 5,000 at a low interest rate of four per cent.
title: Special camps for micro credit scheme
